game.title: Fictorial
game.description: Fictorial LLC is a independent app and game development shop for hire founded in 2008 focusing on the iOS platform.

history.text: Work on the client app "Chumkee" wrapped on in June, 2012. Fictorial then designed and developed "Lexatron", an "amazingly sleek" word game as a new twist for bored players of classic games such as "Scrabble" and "Words with Friends". Lexatron is available on the iOS App Store since October, 2012.

Fictorial worked with C-Vibes Ltd to create "Glimpsed" (since removed from the App Store), a social engagement app. Then followed a long client engagement with C-Vibes Ltd on "Chumkee", an innovative audio-visual photo and video sharing experience with social networking aspects. Fictorial played the role of a consultant and sole developer on Chumkee, designing several of its key features while implementing all features. Also created in 2011 was "RPS World Masters: Online Rock Paper Scissors" which was created to learn Game Center's multiplayer gaming aspects.

Fictorial developed PlayRelay, an innovative multiplayer middleware platform for iOS games. PlayRelay was a huge undertaking and a valuable learning experience. From it, Fictorial gained experience in the areas of scalable backend server architectures and modern "NoSQL" databases. Several Open Source projects came from this work including "Jefe", a Node.js sandboxing environment. Ultimately, the plug was pulled on PlayRelay when Apple announced Game Center. This proved to be the right decision given that Game Center now supports turn-based gaming effectively killing any market that PlayRelay might have captured.
Fictorial worked as an independent contractor on small iOS projects such as "iTap 21".
Fictorial designed and developed "Darts" which went #1 on the free charts in December, 2008 and has been enjoyed by millions of iOS users.
